title: Admin creates a new user account with a primary role
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new user account by providing their name, email, and assigning a primary role, so that I can securely grant a new employee the appropriate level of system access to perform their job duties.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Successful creation of a new user with a primary role; Attempt to create a user with a non-unique email address fails with error; Attempt to create a user with missing required information fails.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >80% coverage; Manual E2E testing completed; Deployed to staging.
deployment_notes: Requires base security groups to be defined.
business_value: Enables secure onboarding of new employees by provisioning role-based access to the system.

title: Admin assigns a primary role to a user
description: As an Admin, I want to assign a single, predefined primary role (like Dispatch Manager, Finance Officer, or Driver) to a user account, so that I can efficiently manage access control and ensure each user has the appropriate permissions.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Assign a primary role to a user; Role selection is mutually exclusive; Admin attempts to change their own role to a non-Admin role fails.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; E2E testing completed; Deployed to staging.
deployment_notes: Depends on the RBAC framework from US-070.
business_value: Enforces a secure and manageable Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system.

title: System Enforces Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for All Data Models
description: As a System Administrator, I want the system to strictly enforce data access and modification rights based on a user's assigned role, so that sensitive company data is protected and operational integrity is maintained.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Finance Officer restricted from operational functions; Driver has restricted, personal access (Record-Level Security); Driver is restricted from viewing sensitive financial data (Field-Level Security).
definition_of_done: Code for security groups, access rights, and record rules is peer-reviewed; Automated integration tests are written; Manual testing cycle completed by QA for each role.
collaboration_required: All developers to understand security model.
business_value: Ensures data security and confidentiality, enforces the principle of least privilege.

title: Admin creates a new vehicle record
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new vehicle record by entering its key details like truck number, model, capacity, and ownership status, so that the vehicle is officially registered in the system.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Successful creation of a new vehicle record; Attempt to create a vehicle with a duplicate Truck Number fails; Attempt to create a vehicle with an invalid Truck Number format fails.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for constraints passing; E2E tests for happy path passing; Deployed to staging.
business_value: Establishes the foundational master data for the vehicle fleet.

title: Admin creates a new driver record by extending an HR employee
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new driver record by adding driver-specific details (like license information) to an existing HR employee record, so that I can properly onboard drivers into the TMS.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Successfully designate an existing HR employee as a driver with all required information; Attempt to save a driver record without mandatory fields fails; Driver-specific fields are hidden for non-driver employees.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration testing completed to ensure driver is available for trip assignment; Security rules restricting access to 'Admin' role verified.
business_value: Enables the creation of a compliant and operational driver pool.

title: Admin creates a new customer record
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new customer record by entering their essential business details, so that the new customer is available for trip planning and invoicing.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Successful creation of a new customer with valid data; Attempt to save a new customer with an invalid GSTIN format fails; New customer defaults to 'Active' status.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for GSTIN validation logic passing; Security check confirms access is restricted to authorized roles.
deployment_notes: Blocker for Trip Management and Invoicing epics.
business_value: Enables new business by onboarding clients into the system.

title: Admin creates and manages pre-defined transportation routes
description: As an Admin, I want to create and manage a master list of pre-defined transportation routes, so that Dispatch Managers can quickly select a standard route during trip creation.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Admin successfully creates a new pre-defined route; System prevents route creation with missing mandatory information; Non-Admin users cannot access route management.
definition_of_done: Code for model, views, and security rules is reviewed; Unit tests covering model constraints are implemented; Security testing confirms non-Admin roles cannot access.
business_value: Improves operational efficiency by reducing manual data entry for trip creation.

title: Admin manages the list of material types and their handling instructions
description: As an Admin, I want to create, view, edit, and deactivate material types and their associated special handling instructions, so that I can ensure data consistency and provide critical handling information.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational User Management, RBAC, and core Master Data models.
acceptance_criteria: Admin creates a new material type successfully; System prevents creation of a material type with a duplicate name; Deactivated material types are not available for selection on new trips.
definition_of_done: Code is peer-reviewed; Unit tests covering model constraints are implemented; Access control rules are implemented and verified.
business_value: Ensures data integrity for accurate reporting and enhances operational safety.

title: Dispatch Manager creates a new trip
description: As a Dispatch Manager, I want to create a new trip record by selecting a customer, defining the route, and specifying the material details and rate, so that I can formally initiate a transport job.
sprint_goal: Build the core trip creation and assignment workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Successful trip creation with all valid manual inputs; Attempt to save a trip with missing mandatory fields fails; Customer selection field only shows active customers; Dynamic revenue calculation based on rate type.
definition_of_done: Code peer-reviewed; Unit tests for business logic passing; E2E tests for happy path and error conditions passing; UI is mobile-responsive.
deployment_notes: Blocker for all subsequent trip management stories.
business_value: Initiates the primary revenue-generating workflow of the system.

title: Dispatch Manager assigns an available vehicle and driver to a trip
description: As a Dispatch Manager, I want to select an available vehicle and driver from filtered lists and assign them to a 'Planned' trip so that I can operationalize the trip.
sprint_goal: Build the core trip creation and assignment workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Successful assignment of a valid vehicle and driver changes status to 'Assigned'; Vehicle selection list is correctly filtered for availability and capacity; Driver selection list is correctly filtered for availability and valid license.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for domain filtering and validation logic passing; Role-based security confirmed.
business_value: Enables the transition of a trip from planning to execution.

title: Driver logs into the mobile-friendly web portal
description: As a Driver, I want to securely log into a simple, mobile-friendly web portal using my credentials, so that I can access my assigned trips and update my status.
sprint_goal: Deliver the MVP for the Driver Portal.
skills_required: Odoo Web Library (OWL), JavaScript, CSS, HTML
acceptance_criteria: Successful login with valid credentials; Login attempt with invalid password fails with generic error; Login page responsiveness on 360px width device.
definition_of_done: E2E automated tests for the login flow are passing; Feature tested on representative iOS and Android devices; Security review confirms adherence to NFRs.
collaboration_required: Odoo backend dev for auth endpoint.
deployment_notes: Blocker for all other driver-facing stories.
business_value: Enables drivers to access the system, the primary entry point for all field-based data capture.

title: Driver submits a trip-related expense with receipt
description: As a Driver, I want to submit a trip-related expense through my mobile web portal by selecting the expense type, entering the amount, and uploading a photo of the receipt.
skills_required: Odoo ORM, OWL, Python, S3 Integration
acceptance_criteria: Successful submission of a standard expense; Attempt to upload an invalid file type or size fails with error; Attempt to submit with missing required fields fails.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for validation logic passing; Integration testing (form -> DB -> S3) completed; UI reviewed for mobile usability.
business_value: Enables accurate and timely tracking of trip expenditures.
